intro: Coccoloba trollii, commonly known as the Trinidadian glorybower, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean, particularly found in Trinidad and Tobago, as well as parts of South America. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves that are typically bright green with a waxy surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, which appear in the spring. Coccoloba trollii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and resilience in tropical climates.
